General course objectives:
General course objectives
To give the theoretical background for formulation and solution of aerodynamic flow problems, including designing a drone, and be able to calculate and design airfoils and plan forms for fixed wing and propeller powered aircraft.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Make a conceptual design of a drone
Describe the basic concepts of lift, drag and vorticity
Describe the basics of potential flow theory
Use conformal mapping to calculate flows past two-dimensional bodies
Use a panel code for airfoils
Explain the basics of airfoils and airfoil theory
Derive the Kutta-Joukowsky theorem
Implement the lifting line method on finite wings in a MatLab script
Implement thin airfoil theory in a MatLab script
Apply momentum theory on rotors
Document a technical calculation in writing in a short and precise form
Present orally a complex problem in a poster
Content: Design of airfoils and wings, including the conceptual design of a drone. Introduction to the fundamental principles and equations in aerodynamics. Incompressible airfoil theory. Potential flow - conformal mapping. The Kutta-Joukowsky theorem. Two-dimensional panel methods. Incompressible flow over finite wings. Lifting line/lifting surface models. Fundamentals of rotor aerodynamics.
Course literature: Various notes will be provided during the course.
